pull.title: net: additional disconnect logging
pull.body:
While debugging unexpected disconnections, possibly related to #28331, I found some additional [net] logging to be useful.

All cases where we disconnect now come with a log message that has the word `disconnecting`:

* `CloseSocketDisconnect()` logs `disconnecting peer=…`
* whereever we set `pnode->fDisconnect = true;`
* for all `InactivityCheck` cases (which in turn sets `fDisconnect`)
* replaces "dropping" with "disconnecting" in `Network not active, dropping peer=…`

Sometimes the reason appears in the line above, e.g.:

```
socket send error for peer=…
disconnecting peer=… 
```

Note that `CloseSocketDisconnect()` always logs `disconnecting` (unless there's no socket), so the message before it doesn't need `disconnecting`, whereas `pnode->fDisconnect = true;` unceremoniously drops the connection without a log message.

issue.title: test: Make existing functional tests compatible with --v2transport
issue.body:
This makes the functional test suite compatible with BIP324, so that 
`python3 test_runner.py --v2transport`
should succeed (currently, 12 tests fail for me on master).
Includes two commits by TheStack I found in an old discussion https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28331#discussion_r1326714164

Note that even though all tests should pass, the python `p2p.py` module will do v2 connections only after the merge of #24748, so that for now only connections between two full nodes will actually run v2.
Some of the fixed tests were added with `--v2transport` to the test runner. Though after #24748 we might also want to consider running the entire suite with `--v2transport` in some CI.

events.body: Concept ACK. I'd find it helpful to also log the addrport if `fLogIPs` is true, along with the network (for instance, because IPv6 addresses look the same as CJDNS ones), e.g. something like `net=..., peeraddr=...,`

net: additional disconnection logging

Use the word "disconnecting" everywhere for easier grep.

events.message:
net: additional disconnection logging

Use the word "disconnecting" everywhere for easier grep.

events.body: I added `peeraddr=` to each of them. This is indeed quite useful, because we can't look up the IP after disconnection. Adding `net=` also makes sense, but let's do that everywhere in another PR (probably using a helper function).

> because we can't look up the IP after disconnection.

Is the IP not logged on connection, when IP logging is enabled?

@maflcko indeed it is, though for inbound it depends on the exact log settings. I think right now you won't see these disconnect messages without `-debug=net` and with it you'll see all the connect messages. But if we increase the relative priority of disconnect messages then you might not. So it still seems useful to add.
Concept ACK. Just a single consideration: wouldn't it also make sense to test this with `-logips=1`?
@sr-gi I could, but I prefer to punt that until we have a helper function that can be tested in just one place: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#issuecomment-1835692974

issue.title: test: use v2 everywhere for P2PConnection if --v2transport is enabled
issue.body:
#24748 added v2 transport to the python `P2PConnection`, but so far each test that wants to make use of it needs to enable it on an individual basis.
This PR changes it so that if the test suite is run with `--v2transport` option, v2 is used in each test by default, not only for connections between two bitcoind instances as before, but also wherever `P2PConnection` is used. Individual tests can override this global option.

To do that, a few tests need to be adjusted, which is done in the first commits.
In addition, I added a commit to always use v1 in a few select subtests that send a large number of large messages (e.g. large reorgs). These tests don't have a fundamental problem with v2 but become very slow due to the unoptimised python ChaCha20 implementation (~30 minutes on my computer, so probably not suitable to be run in the CI).

As a result, `python3 test_runner.py --v2transport` should succeed and use `v2` everywhere (unless v1 is chosen explicitly).

comments.body:
`InactivityCheck()` already logs a reason for any case where it returns true, eg:

```
2023-09-26T07:21:14.013289Z [net] socket receive timeout: 1201s peer=745   <==== this one
2023-09-26T07:21:14.014945Z [net] disconnecting peer=745
2023-09-26T07:21:14.016616Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=745

2023-09-26T08:33:15.016157Z [net] version handshake timeout peer=9862    <=== and this one
2023-09-26T08:33:15.016539Z [net] disconnecting peer=9862
2023-09-26T08:33:15.017321Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=9862
```

Does an extra log entry here actually help? Would adding the word "disconnecting" to the log entries in `InactivityCheck()` be better?
Done, and also made sure the keyword `disconnecting` appears in all cases where we disconnect.
No, because `CloseSocketDisconnect` already uses that term. I updated the PR description (yesterday) to explain the reasoning here.
